verses.kjv: And David made him houses in the city of David, and prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched for it a tent.
verses.web: David made himself houses in David’s city; and he prepared a place for God’s ark, and pitched a tent for it.
verses.ct: David built several houses for himself in the city of David. He also prepared a place for the ark of God and set up a tent for it.

verses.kjv: Then David said, None ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites: for them hath the LORD chosen to carry the ark of God, and to minister unto him for ever.
verses.web: Then David said, “No one ought to carry God’s ark but the Levites. For LORD has chosen them to carry God’s ark, and to minister to him forever.”
verses.ct: Then David said, "No one should carry the ark of God except the Levites, because the LORD chose them to carry his ark and to serve him forever."

verses.kjv: And David gathered all Israel together to Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the LORD unto his place, which he had prepared for it.
verses.web: David assembled all Israel at Jerusalem, to bring up LORD’s ark to its place, which he had prepared for it.
verses.ct: David assembled all of Israel in Jerusalem to bring the ark of the LORD to the place he had prepared for it.

verses.kjv: And David assembled the children of Aaron, and the Levites:
verses.web: David gathered together the sons of Aaron and the Levites:
verses.ct: David gathered the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Kohath; Uriel the chief, and his brethren an hundred and twenty:
verses.web: of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and his brothers one hundred twenty;
verses.ct: From the descendants of Kohath: Uriel the leader, along with 120 of his relatives.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Merari; Asaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred and twenty:
verses.web: of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, and his brothers two hundred twenty;
verses.ct: From the descendants of Merari: Asaiah the leader, along with 220 of his relatives.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Gershom; Joel the chief, and his brethren an hundred and thirty:
verses.web: of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, and his brothers one hundred thirty;
verses.ct: From the descendants of Gershom: Joel the leader, along with 130 of his relatives.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Elizaphan; Shemaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred:
verses.web: of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, and his brothers two hundred;
verses.ct: From the descendants of Elizaphan: Shemaiah the leader, along with 200 of his relatives.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Hebron; Eliel the chief, and his brethren fourscore:
verses.web: of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, and his brothers eighty;
verses.ct: From the descendants of Hebron: Eliel the leader, along with 80 of his relatives.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Uzziel; Amminadab the chief, and his brethren an hundred and twelve.
verses.web: of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, and his brothers one hundred twelve.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Uzziel: Amminadab the leader, along with 112 of his relatives.

verses.kjv: And David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah, and Joel, Shemaiah, and Eliel, and Amminadab,
verses.web: David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab,
verses.ct: David summoned the priests Zadok and Abiathar, along with the Levite leaders — Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, Ye are the chief of the fathers of the Levites: sanctify yourselves, both ye and your brethren, that ye may bring up the ark of the LORD God of Israel unto the place that I have prepared for it.
verses.web: and said to them, “You are the heads of the fathers’ households of the Levites. Sanctify yourselves, both you and your brothers, that you may bring the ark of LORD, the God of Israel, up to the place that I have prepared for it.
verses.ct: He told them, "You are the heads of the Levite families. Sanctify yourselves, you and your relatives, so you can bring the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel, to the place I've prepared for it."

verses.kjv: For because ye did it not at the first, the LORD our God made a breach upon us, for that we sought him not after the due order.
verses.web: For because you didn’t carry it at first, LORD our God broke out in anger against us, because we didn’t seek him according to the ordinance.”
verses.ct: "The first time we tried, you weren't the ones who carried it, and the LORD our God lashed out against us because we didn't follow the proper procedure."

verses.kjv: So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the LORD God of Israel.
verses.web: So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of LORD, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: And the children of the Levites bare the ark of God upon their shoulders with the staves thereon, as Moses commanded according to the word of the LORD.
verses.web: The children of the Levites bore God’s ark on their shoulders with its poles, as Moses commanded according to LORD’s word.
verses.ct: The Levites carried the ark of God on their shoulders using the poles, exactly as Moses had commanded according to the word of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And David spake to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brethren to be the singers with instruments of musick, psalteries and harps and cymbals, sounding, by lifting up the voice with joy.
verses.web: David spoke to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brothers as singers with instruments of music, stringed instruments, harps, and cymbals, sounding aloud and lifting up their voices with joy.
verses.ct: David told the Levite leaders to appoint some of their relatives as musicians, playing stringed instruments, harps, and cymbals — filling the air with joyful music.

verses.kjv: So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari their brethren, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;
verses.web: So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brothers, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari their brothers, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;
verses.ct: So the Levites appointed Heman son of Joel, his relative Asaph son of Berechiah, and from the Merari branch of their family, Ethan son of Kushaiah.

verses.kjv: And with them their brethren of the second degree, Zechariah, Ben, and Jaaziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, Eliab, and Benaiah, and Maaseiah, and Mattithiah, and Elipheleh, and Mikneiah, and Obededom, and Jeiel, the porters.
verses.web: and with them their brothers of the second rank, Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, the doorkeepers.
verses.ct: Serving with them in the second rank were Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel, who served as gatekeepers.

verses.kjv: So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were appointed to sound with cymbals of brass;
verses.web: So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were given cymbals of bronze to sound aloud;
verses.ct: The singers Heman, Asaph, and Ethan were assigned to play bronze cymbals.

verses.kjv: And Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with psalteries on Alamoth;
verses.web: and Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with stringed instruments set to Alamoth;
verses.ct: Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah played stringed instruments tuned to Alamoth.

verses.kjv: And Mattithiah, and Elipheleh, and Mikneiah, and Obededom, and Jeiel, and Azaziah, with harps on the Sheminith to excel.
verses.web: and Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah, with harps tuned to the eight-stringed lyre, to lead.
verses.ct: Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah played harps tuned to the Sheminith, leading the music.

verses.kjv: And Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was for song: he instructed about the song, because he was skilful.
verses.web: Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was over the singing. He taught the singers, because he was skillful.
verses.ct: Chenaniah, the chief Levite, directed the singing because of his skill — he was the one who trained the musicians.

verses.kjv: And Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark.
verses.web: Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark.
verses.ct: Berechiah and Elkanah served as gatekeepers for the ark.

verses.kjv: And Shebaniah, and Jehoshaphat, and Nethaneel, and Amasai, and Zechariah, and Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, did blow with the trumpets before the ark of God: and Obededom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.
verses.web: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, blew the trumpets before God’s ark; and Obed-Edom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.
verses.ct: The priests Shebaniah, Jehoshaphat, Nethaneel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer blew trumpets in front of the ark of God. Obed-edom and Jehiah also served as gatekeepers for the ark.

verses.kjv: So David, and the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands, went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the LORD out of the house of Obededom with joy.
verses.web: So David, the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands, went to bring the ark of LORD’s covenant up out of the house of Obed-Edom with joy.
verses.ct: David, the elders of Israel, and the commanders over thousands went with great joy to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD from the house of Obed-edom.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when God helped the Levites that bare the ark of the covenant of the LORD, that they offered seven bullocks and seven rams.
verses.web: When God helped the Levites who bore the ark of LORD’s covenant, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
verses.ct: When God helped the Levites who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the LORD, they sacrificed 7 bulls and 7 rams.

verses.kjv: And David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, and all the Levites that bare the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah the master of the song with the singers: David also had upon him an ephod of linen.
verses.web: David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who bore the ark, the singers, and Chenaniah the choir master with the singers; and David had an ephod of linen on him.
verses.ct: David wore a robe of fine linen, as did all the Levites carrying the ark, the singers, and Chenaniah the music director. David also wore a linen ephod.

verses.kjv: Thus all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the LORD with shouting, and with sound of the cornet, and with trumpets, and with cymbals, making a noise with psalteries and harps.
verses.web: Thus all Israel brought the ark of LORD’s covenant up with shouting, with sound of the cornet, with trumpets, and with cymbals, sounding aloud with stringed instruments and harps.
verses.ct: All of Israel brought the ark of the covenant of the LORD up with shouts of joy, the blast of horns, trumpets, and cymbals, along with the music of stringed instruments and harps.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as the ark of the covenant of the LORD came to the city of David, that Michal, the daughter of Saul looking out at a window saw king David dancing and playing: and she despised him in her heart.
verses.web: As the ark of LORD’s covenant came to David’s city, Michal the daughter of Saul looked out at the window, and saw king David dancing and playing; and she despised him in her heart.
verses.ct: As the ark of the covenant of the LORD entered the city of David, Michal daughter of Saul watched from a window. When she saw King David dancing and celebrating, she despised him in her heart.
